summary: This document is an invoice from FedEx addressed to Jeffrey Epstein, detailing charges for shipping services. The invoice includes information about the shipping address, billing account, and total charges due. It also mentions a change in handling policies effective April 16, 2001.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary individual associated with this invoice, listed as the shipper and billing account holder.

persons.name: Eric Gany
persons.context: Eric Gany is mentioned as a billing account holder alongside Jeffrey Epstein on the invoice.

persons.name: Sally Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Sally Jeffrey Epstein is listed as the recipient of a package sent by Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell is mentioned as the sender of a package that was shipped by Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Both are associated with the billing account for the FedEx invoice.
Sally Jeffrey Epstein is the recipient of a package sent by Jeffrey Epstein.
Ghislaine Maxwell is mentioned in connection with a package sent by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Invoice Issued
events.description: An invoice was issued to Jeffrey Epstein for shipping services provided by FedEx.

events.title: Package Dropped Off
events.description: A package was dropped off for shipment by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Policy Change Effective
events.description: New handling surcharges and policies for FedEx services are set to take effect.

locations: 457 Madison Ave FL 4, New York, NY 10022-6809
355 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL 33480
keyFacts: The invoice is dated April 2, 2001, and is addressed to Jeffrey Epstein.
Total charges on the invoice amount to $18.77 after discounts.
The invoice includes a mention of a package sent from a specific zip code.
Ghislaine Maxwell is noted as the sender of a package associated with Epstein.
There is a change in FedEx policy regarding handling surcharges effective April 16, 2001.
